page.title: 15TRANSPORT IN INVERKEILOR
page.content: The block is divided by two main transport routes.The A92 main Dundee_Aberdeen road and the main Dundee_Aberdeen railway line.There is also a good network of minor roads.A bus service operates on the A92 which can take local people to Arbroath and Montrose for shopping,but the railway station at the village of Inverkeilor has been disused for many years and recently been dismolished. We found that most people use a private car to get around but the buses are also well used. The A92 is a busy road with a lot of heavy traffic.This means that Inverkeilor village main street is always busy and there is a dangerous corner at the north end of the village.Plans have been made for the road to by_pass the village to the west.This should be built by 1988.
